intro: Alangium javanicum var. minahassicum, commonly known as the Minahassa alangium, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
